metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:accesstoken_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:accesstoken_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that a accesstoken_object with a security_principle is supported.
Test that a accesstoken_object with a security_principle pattern match is supported.
Test that a accesstoken_object with a security_principle not equals is supported.
Test that the include_group behavior is supported.
Test that the resolve_group behavior is supported.

accesstoken_test.comment: Test that a accesstoken_object with a security_principle is supported.
Test that a accesstoken_object with a security_principle pattern match is supported.
Test that a accesstoken_object with a security_principle not equals is supported.
Test that the include_group behavior is supported.
Test that the resolve_group behavior is supported.

accesstoken_object.comment: A accesstoken_object with a security_principle that equals 'SYSTEM'.
A accesstoken_object with a security_principle that matches the regular expression 'SYS[A-Z]*'.
A accesstoken_object with a security_principle that is not equal to 'SYSTEM'.
A accesstoken_object with a security_principle that equals 'ADMINISTRATORS', the include_group behavior set to true, and the resolve_group behavior set to true.
A accesstoken_object with a security_principle that equals 'ADMINISTRATORS', the include_group behavior set to false, and the resolve_group behavior set to true.

accesstoken_state.comment: This accesstoken_state represents an access token which has a security_principle that equals 'SYSTEM'.
This accesstoken_state represents an access token with a security_principle that matches the regular expression 'SYS[A-Z]*'.
This accesstoken_state represents an access token which has a security_principle that is not equal to 'SYSTEM'.
This represents a accesstoken_state which has a security_principle that equals 'ADMINISTRATORS'.
This accesstoken_state represents an access token which has a security_principle that matches the regular expression '[A-Z]*'.
